function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'foo' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'n < elems' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'n < elems' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'heap_len >= 2' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'heap_len >= 2' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'n < elems' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'heap_len >= 2' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'heap (line 1)' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'heap_len (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Does variable 'm' remain in use at the end of function 'foo'?
Is variable 'elems' live at the end of function 'foo'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'heap[--heap_max] = n;' be considered dead code?
Is this statement not dead: “m = heap[1];”?
